trans-unit.source: In a usual scenario, we use an event processing engine to compute streaming data with very low latency.
trans-unit.target: In a usual scenario, we use an event processing engine to compute streaming data with very low latency.

trans-unit.source: In many cases users need to correlate persisted historical data or a slow changing dataset (aka.

trans-unit.source: reference data) with the real-time event stream to make smarter decisions about the system.

trans-unit.source: For example, join my event stream to a static dataset which maps IP Addresses to locations.
trans-unit.target: For example, join my event stream to a static dataset which maps IP Addresses to locations.

trans-unit.source: This is the only JOIN supported in Stream Analytics where a temporal bound is not necessary.
trans-unit.target: This is the only JOIN supported in Stream Analytics where a temporal bound is not necessary.

trans-unit.source: If a commercial vehicle is registered with the Toll Company, they can pass through the toll booth without being stopped for inspection.
trans-unit.target: If a commercial vehicle is registered with the Toll Company, they can pass through the toll booth without being stopped for inspection.

trans-unit.source: We will use a commercial vehicle registration lookup table to identify all commercial vehicles with expired registration.
trans-unit.target: We will use a commercial vehicle registration lookup table to identify all commercial vehicles with expired registration.

trans-unit.source: Using Reference Data JOIN requires that an input source for Reference Data is defined.
trans-unit.target: Using Reference Data JOIN requires that an input source for Reference Data is defined.
